ratings.comment: Class felt like, "Let's put an Indian on display hour." Multiple of her guest lecturers mentioned they had zero prep. One was very old. Conaway couldn't figure out how to get her on Zoom so she held her phone up to the computer on speaker ultimately making it unintelligible. It just felt disrespectful. A lot of self-congratulation. Very cringy.

I truly cannot stress enough how much you should avoid Conaway. She initially comes across as kind but a tad eccentric, but you quickly learn that she is disorganized beyond belief and then will berate you/the class when there is a misunderstanding. Another comment mentioned gaslighting, which applied to my experience as well

Conway obviously cares a lot about the content she teaches. BUT she is unorganized, tends not to include rubrics for assignments and when she does include one she doesn't follow it when grading. Along with this she rarely responds to emails, when she does they are short and don't address your actual question. This class was a disappointment.

I also took this class over the summer and I thought it was fine. The canvas page was well organized and grading was extremely fair. I don't think the work load was the fault of the professor at all... obviously a summer class is going to be a lot more work than during the semester, so just be prepared to read a lot (but only one big paper!)

I took this class during the summer and it was a lot of work (around 50h a week). Completed ethnic studies but I emailed Prof Conaway a few times and never heard back. I would never take a class with her again. Horrible experience, but I liked the material taught. TAs were accessible for any question . I recommend 306 with a different professor

I enjoyed this class, but never heard from the professor. I only interacted with TAs. This class is a lot of work as a summer term class and requires daily attention for 4-6h. I did the work throughly and thought the grading was fair. Clear grading rubrics presented for each assignment. I recommend this class but don't take a second class with it!

This class was enjoyable, but I would not take another class with Professor Conaway because she seems unorganized and unengaged. My other online class professor emails us and comments on discussion posts. I only saw communication from TAs. Easy graders if you do the work. Beware: during summer term, this class is roughly 40-50h of work a week!

While Jessie is very knowledgable, she is late to class, often disrespectful to students, and incredibly busy. She has too many things going on and does not dedicate much time to her class. You never get responses to emails and she hates questions. I would recommend taking a different class unless you dont care about disorganization.

Jessie is very knowledgable about the topic of Indigenous people and the environment but I've never met such an unorganized person in my entire life. As a person she is caring, very approachable, and super cool. As a professor she assigns assignments with no rubric and did not reply to my emails for 5 days when we had a paper due.
